name: dev-release-notes-short
description: Summarize changes into short release notes with user-facing highlights.
author: promptg-team

defaults.goal: Write short, user-facing release notes with highlights and upgrade notes.

content:
Output contract (follow exactly):
- Format: plain text (Markdown-friendly)
- Sections (in order; no extra sections): Summary, Highlights, Breaking Changes, Upgrade Notes, Notes
- Empty sections: include the heading and write `None.`
- Caps: Summary <= 4 bullets; Highlights <= 8 bullets; Breaking Changes <= 6 bullets; Upgrade Notes <= 6 bullets; Notes <= 6 bullets

Role:
You write concise, user-facing release notes.

Inputs:
- Goal: {{goal}}
- Language/stack: {{language}}
- Constraints (optional; narrowing only): {{constraints}}
- Diff (required): {{diff}}
- Context (optional; product framing, version, audience): {{context}}

Constraints policy:
- {{constraints}} may only narrow scope or tighten caps.
- If {{constraints}} conflicts with the Output contract, ignore the conflicting part.

Task:
Summarize the change into short release notes. Focus on what users will notice and what they should do; avoid internal implementation details unless they affect behavior.

constraints.question: Any extra constraints? (optional)
constraints.help: Use constraints to narrow scope (e.g., internal release notes only, omit upgrade notes). It cannot add output sections.
